column8: Kishida has repeatedly expressed the wish to enhance ties with Global South countries......Japan's Prime Minister Kishida Fumio will head for India to meet his counterpart Narendra Modi and call for cooperation on global issues, such as the situation in Ukraine...Kishida leaves Japan late Sunday night and returns home on Wednesday...Japan is the chair of the Group of Seven nations this year and India serves as the chair of the Group of 20 economies...India is also considered one of the leaders among emerging and developing nations collectively known as the Global South. Some of these countries are said to be taking a neutral position on the situation in Ukraine...Kishida has repeatedly expressed the wish to enhance ties with Global South countries...When he meets Modi, he plans to stress the importance of international order based on the rule of law...Kishida also plans to unveil concrete plans to promote a free and open Indo-Pacific, which Japan advocates, in his speech to a think tank in India./-

column7: It is forty-seven years since the Central Highlands of Vietnam and the Dega people country fell into North communist Vietnam on 10 March 1975. They convey the conception of this day into what they call "NGÃ€Y Lá»„ Há»˜I CÃ€ PHÃŠ "in English, "COFFEE FESTIVAL DAY," to celebrate their victory every year. And to transfer, to make Dega people into nothingness and complete annihilation..Our lands in the Central Highlands of Vietnam include nearly 2 million hectares of fertile basalt soil suitable for industrial crops like rubber, coffee, cocoa, pepper, mulberry, and tea. Coffee has become the area's essential industrial commodity, and the French had already begun to exploit some of that..But to our Rhade people, coffee is a tragedy that inflicts pain, suffering, and hurt upon our children and us. We suffer political and economic enslavement and are the target of genocide because of coffee. The production of coffee is a significant factor in what is, in effect, the end of the world for us; a story of killing and systematic destruction of our history, culture, language, and identity. The seizure of our lands to produce and consume modernly refined and the best-tasting coffee is, in effect, the blood of the Dega people..We are not only losing our traditional clan land but also facing the frightening experience of no longer existing. Some could remain but transform to the oppressor's terms and enslave..Similar to genocide worldwide is the denial at the final stage of genocide by the perpetrator. They abuse and sell our identity, including dressing our traditional costumes to fool the world that everything about the Dega people is intact in the Central Highlands of Vietnam..DON'T FORGET THE DEGA PEOPLE'S GENOCIDE.

column8: Shared a Story from : Y Bhim Nie (Type: User, ID: 100047004893475).Dear friends,.Please enjoy the clip video and part of the music â€œLong Night of Loveâ€ by Angeligth â€œand Skeeter Davisâ€™s song â€œThe End of The World.â€.March 10, 1975, WAS THE END OF THE WORLD FOR DEGA PEOPLE.I am not a politician, a lawyer, a prosecutor, or a judge. However, the day I survived the bombing at the Buon Pang Lam on the North East side of Ban me Thuot city in the Central Highlands of Vietnam, which killed more than sixty Rhade people, including my close friends when we escaped from our dormitory of the complex mild school of Ban Me Thuot when North communist Vietnam attacked the city..They did come with the tank, and today, that tank still parks in the circle center of Ban Me Thuot city as a symbol of their Victory..I have survived and continue to as every human being has a right to exist the only way the past can be addressed appropriately, and I will never forget it as long as I am still alive. To them, it was the day of their Victory. I call it the day end of the world for our Rhade people..That day was March 10, 1975, under the name â€˜Liberationâ€ the ideology of communism of Ho Chi Minh to unify Vietnam was, in effect, the day to defeat the Dega people, even though our people has never declared war with anyone else, but because our ancestral lands, along with our history, culture, identity, and language have to be destroyed in order successful in unifying Vietnam..Yes, it is the end of the world for us, but since then and now, everything associated with us, such as ancestral land, culture, and language, we have nothing left, just memory, and have become the last target to eradicate..Yes, it is the end of the world, because we used to be a quasi-independent state with our form of organization, administration, court, and law enforcement in our society, clan land, family, and school for our children. A sense of a group of people and community It is called the â€œPays Montagnard du Sud Indochinaâ€™sâ€ (PMSI) Under French colonial regions of Southeast Asia from colonization in 1887 to 1954..So, it was not until the beginning of the Republic of (South) Vietnam under President Ngo Dinh Diem, who annexed the entire Central Highlands to Vietnam on March 11, 1955, and began being occupied by Vietnamese settlers that we became subject to Vietnamese rule and the seizure of our traditional clan lands by Vietnamese settlers and their business interests..In the meantime, on April 21, 1975, our leader Y Bham Enuol, his family, and more than one hundred fifty our Dega people elite leaders including my family members, were murdered by Pol Pot Khmer Rouge, where they lived in exile in Phnom Penh, Cambodia..All those events above were part of a long, slowly-developing process of humiliation, exclusion, persecution, deprivation, hatred, and living diaspora where we have no land, culture, language, or even name.

column7: A haft century ago, her ancestor, the land owner, lived comfortably in their longhouse, sustainably with their rice field and their cow, buffalo, and elephant that she was supposed to be in heritage. Still, she becomes a trash picker with the baby on her back in Ban Me Thuot city in the Central Highlands of Vietnam to make a living today..Dear friends, this is just a piece of the iceberg images of the Dega people in the Central Highlands. Hundreds of thousands enslaved, working on the farm of Vietnamese colonial settlers or state plantations and private corporations after their ancestral land fell to the Vietnamese colonial settlers, the Vietnamese communist state, and private corporations..So, where do we go? when we have no land, culture, language, or name?.DON'T FORGET THE DEGA GENOCIDE

This clip video is a joke to President Biden and North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper if compared to the Vinfast electric car company Vietnamese in Chatham county North Carolina which is Montagnard Dega's second home..The Vietnam War was in haft a century ago and far away, fifteen thousand miles from America. They have become in America by stopping us from becoming in the homeland..It is precise; yesterday, I called my nephew back to the Central Highlands of Vietnam. , the Dega people have nothing left after their ancestor's land has gone to try to compete to make a living by working on the farm of Vietnamese settlers or communist state plantations to have money to buy a portion of food, not an electric car. .DON'T FORGET THE DEGA PEOPLE GENOCIDE.
column8: Shared a Story from : Y Bhim Nie (Type: User, ID: 100047004893475).DEAR FRIENDS,.My other clip video of a gift to the world is called â€œA TEARS OF A MOTHER DEGA PEOPLE.â€.I say a gift to the world, especially to those who visit the Central Highlands of Vietnam today; what their ears hear and their eyes see about the Rhade people today is that they have not become a thing yet, but still become something. Something turned into an exotic museum object of dressing in black and red in Rhade traditional costume by the Vietnamese oppressor.. Drei jing pÈ lÄƒn ÃªlÃ¢o hÄ­n kÆ¡ mtao Báº£o Äáº¡i , ÃªlÃ¢o hÄ­n kÆ¡ klei  mkÅ mjing knuk kna YuÄƒn Nah DhÅ­ng ( Viá»‡t Nam Cá»™ng HÃ²a), leh anÄƒn ÃªlÃ¢o hÄ­n kÆ¡ YuÄƒn Klin Nah DÆ°r bi mjing ViÃªtnam jing sa thÅ­n 1975 hlÅng truh kÆ¡ arÄƒ anei..KÆ¡yua anÄƒn, hlÄƒm hla kak rÅ­p lÄƒn, djÄƒp hnoh Ãªa, djÄƒp Ãªa krÈng, kmrÆ¡Ì†ng dhÈng, ÄÆ°Ì† ÄhiÄƒng ti dlÈng LÄƒn Dap KngÆ° Äih anÄƒn hÅng klei Rhade...WHO IS DEGA PEOPLE?.The Dega is a separate race with a single origin; they evolved through the same processes and stages. The differences among them were insignificant compared to the similarities of other ethnicities in South East Asia.  .We are ethnically distinct from the leading group of Vietnamese. We descend from Malaysia ethnic Austronesian linguistic roots, and we speak a language called Rhade, a member of the Chamic subgroup of the Austronesian language. We refer our self as an â€œAnak Dega.â€ It means the son of Hâ€™De and Y â€˜Ga. .Hâ€™De is our great-great-grandmother, and Yâ€™Ga is our great-great-grandfather..We have our transcript in the Rhade. We have our own culture..We have our administration, court, and school teaching in Rhade.Our ancestors know to clarify their offspring if a female must have the prefix letter "H" goes before their names if a male must have the prefix letter " Y" goes before their names. .This factor makes us different from other ethnicities..French colonial in Indochina having recognized that Dega people geographically, ethnicity, culturally, language, ways of life, and dressing differently from the Vietnamese race, and granted the Central Highlands as an Independent country just as Laos, Cambodia, and Vietnam..For a reason, geographically, in every single stream, rivers, jungles, and mountains in the Central Highlands have written names in Rhade.

column7: The day of the first President Ngo Dinh Diem of the Republic of Vietnam annexed the Central Highlands Dega peopleâ€™s country to become part of South Vietnam after the Geneva accord 1954 is the first part of a long, slowly-developing process of humiliation, exclusion, persecution, deprivation and hatred.. Ngo Ding Diem's motive and genocidal strategy stemmed from his Vietnamese ancestor's ideals of "march to the south" (Nam tiáº¿n) to expand the country and stealing the Dega people's land. He devised a policy to destroy the infrastructure of Dega people by dissolving the legal administration and judicial system, burning all documents and banning the teaching of the Rhade language in the school, and in the media. He conducted the Vietnamese population's settlement in the Central Highlands Dega people country and imposing the national pattern of Vietnamese on Dega people. And turn Dega people to be come minority on their own ancestral land..According to Raphael Lemkin, he is a Polish-Jewish lawyer and the father of the United Nations Genocide Convention of 1948. He stated that genocide has two faces: one, the national destruction pattern of the oppressed group and the other, the imposition of the national model of the oppressor group. Thus, Ngo Dinh Diem's annexed the Central Highlands and his policy to destroy the Dega people's infrastructure. Dissolving the legal administration and judicial system, and assaulted the entire social order, burning all documents and banning the teaching of the Rhade language in the school, and in the media. Flooding with the Vietnamese population in the Central Highlands Dega people country, and turning Dega people to become minority on their ancestral land fit Raphael Lemkin's definition of genocide neatly
WHAT DESTROYED IN THE DEGA GENOCIDE (IN THE MORALITY).By Dega Holocaust
column8: Forty-five years ago, before the North communist Vietnam takes over the Central Highlands, Dega people was a relatively peaceful and homogenous community with a low level of violent crimes. They live in harmony with nature, honest, humble, hardworking, loving children, obeying adults, and respecting each other. This traditional hierarchical order in which Dega people and the practical value of the feelings of rank the maintenance of law and order..The highly placed chiefs of every village eventually never displayed any overbearing conduct or haughtiness with a higher degree of hospitality and no hostility toward outsiders. From these values, traditions, heritage, culture, and ways of life make them human.. This system seemed responsible for the almost complete absence of crime and violence in the Central Highlands. Steeling and begging were considered shameful; Drinking alcohol is something that belongs to older adults for occasional entertainment. Their house doesn't need to be locked because there were no burglary, theft, or robberies committed by people..Destroying morality is among the things that we have learned from the logistic genocide during forty-five years of brutal destruction. Primarily, attacking Dega people's culture, such as burning all the material documents in the Rhade language, is the primary goal of North communist Vietnam. Among, it focused on pushing an agenda that goes against the values of a Dega people's society, they quickly move to another plan that goes even further against Dega people's social norms..Communist Vietnam doesnâ€™t need an atomic bomb to complete their genocide process on Dega people. They know Nuclear weapons required either plutonium or highly enriched uranium, which had few suppliers, and sophisticated chemical and engineering process and equipment were needed the fissionable material. But through the policy of setting their colonialist Vietnamese settlers in every place Dega people living, and with the level high school chemistry knowledge of colonialist Vietnamese settlers to make alcohol to destroy the brain old and young Dega people to obtain their land and turn Dega people society full of the drunkard, robbery, stealing, violence, and prostitute.Communist Vietnam doesnâ€™t aim to create a utopia. Its real goals are the destruction of morality and religion, and the inciting of struggle and hatred among the Dega people. This ties to the very heart of the communist Vietnam system. The end goal of communism is the annihilation of all morals and values, culture, hierarchy outside its control, and any order that can have power over a personâ€™s psyche or moral restraint..These are the talking points of communism in the Central Highlands in Vietnamâ€” to step into the breach of ideas with the goal is the destruction of humanity through the elimination of morality and traditional ways of life..The Dega people survivors are being destroyed deep down inside the valuable core of human moral and righteous behavior.  Communism has killed the most basic social values and, in every individual, Dega person.. Dega peopleâ€™s only hope is to purge itself from the venom of communism; to escape this catastrophe, the Dega people need the help from the world communities and recognize the destruction of genocide on morality so we can return to tradition and improve morality.
